title: Fort Vancouver National Historic Site: Park Home
body: Discover the Story of the Pacific Northwest  Located on the north bank of the Columbia River, in sight of snowy mountain peaks and a vibrant urban landscape, this park has a rich cultural past. From a frontier fur trading post, to a powerful military legacy, the magic of flight, and the origin of the American Pacific Northwest, history is shared at four unique sites. Discover stories of transition, settlement, conflict, and community.              Celebrate the Centennial!   Join us on August 27 to celebrate the Centennial Year of the National Park Service!            Catch up on the latest news!   Read our latest Park News & Guide to learn more about visiting the park this fall and winter.        Experience the park after dark!   Join us for a Lantern Tour of Fort Vancouver, Vancouver Barracks, or the McLoughlin House.
